title: Quantum Groups in Mathematical Finance. (arXiv:1711.07279v9 [q-fin.MF] UPDATED)
abstract: The relationship between expectation and price is commonly established with two principles: no-arbitrage, which asserts that both maps are positive; and equivalence, which asserts that the maps share the same null events. Constructed from the Arrow-Debreu securities, classical and quantum models of economics are then distinguished by their respective use of classical and quantum logic, following the program of von Neumann.  In this essay, the operations and axioms of quantum groups are discovered in the minimal preconditions of stochastic and functional calculus, making this the natural domain for the axiomatic development of mathematical finance. translated_abstract: 期望与价格之间的关系通常通过两个原则建立：无套利原理，它断言这两个映射是正的；等价原理，它断言这两个映射共享相同的零事件. 经济学的经典和量子模型是从Arrow-Debreu证券构建而来的，并通过他们各自使用的经典和量子逻辑来区分，遵循冯·诺伊曼的计划。在这篇文章中，发现了量子群的运算和公理在随机和函数微积分的最小前提条件中，使其成为数学金融的公理化发展的自然领域。量子经济出现在Gelfand-Naimark-Segal结构的两个支柱上，实现无套利原则，以及Radon-Nikodym定理，实现等价原理。利用量子群的对偶性，一种交换状态和可观测性角色的全息原理创造了两个不同的经济学模型。
tldr: 本论文在随机和函数微积分的最小前提条件中发现了量子群的运算和公理，为数学金融的公理化发展提供了自然领域。量子经济出现在Gelfand-Naimark-Segal结构和Radon-Nikodym定理的基础上，并利用量子群的对偶性创造了两种不同的经济学模型。
en_tdlr: This paper discovers the operations and axioms of quantum groups in the minimal preconditions of stochastic and functional calculus, providing a natural domain for the axiomatic development of mathematical finance. Quantum economics emerges from the pillars of the Gelfand-Naimark-Segal construction and the Radon-Nikodym theorem, and creates two distinct economic models using quantum group duality.
